ratings.comment: Doc Cook is the sweetest coolest professor in the animal science department. I love his passion for poultry. I also really like how he lectures using personal stories, I find it very fascinating. He's a very smart guy with an awesome southdrawl. You'll love him as a professor!!

A funny, one-of-a-kind, and passionate professor! Always has interesting and hilarious stories to tell during lecture, sometimes taking him a little off track, but it's  always enjoyable. Definitely important to listen to every word he says; his lecture slides are mostly pictures, so every word he says is critical. Would love to have him again!
He was great! Very clear and graded easy

Prof. Cook is amazing. Very well set up course, educational and engaging labs, terrific lectures. There is a different lecturer almost every class period, so you get exposed to numerous fields and information. Tests and quizzes are a tad difficult, but passable. Cook is hands down the best Prof. I have had thus far. Would recommend.
good solid prof
Favorite professor so far, very interesting to listen to and very passionate in his studies. I visited him at his office hours and he is a hoot.
Best teacher I've ever had. Wish he taught more lectures. Brilliant man. Visit his office hours.
The class is taught by him Prof. Combs, and he is definitely the more interesting one.  Lectures are pretty entertaining and easy, labs are fun.

Took An Sci/ Dy Sci 101 with him. He's a great lecturer and very engaging. I would have to say he is my favorite prof so far eventhough he's a little nuts, but what can you expect he's a poultry guy. Visiting him during office hours is a great way to kill time and usually you tangent and talk about something unrelated. His office is a mess though.

Probably my favorite professor. He really cares about animal issues and about engaging his students and hearing what they have to say. I had him in 101 as well and he really made the class entertaining and easy to learn because I became engaged in the material. He's really laid back, yet creates an environment conducive to learning. take his class!

one of my favorite teachers on campus. Very helpful and always willing to listen to what students have to say. Lectures are not required but are fun to go to due to the professor's knowledge of the subject as well as his stories. Great guy all around.
Mark's classes are quite easy and interesting.  I've also taken An Sci 101 and the same applies.  He has taught for a long time and knows the information well.
By far my favorite professor here. The labs are insanely cool and hands-on and the information is very interesting. I loved this class, and even attended every lecture (big-time skipper here).

Great professor.  Truly has a passion for animal (and specifically, poultry) sciences.  Does a great job at connecting the science to present social issues and helping the class understand the importance and relevance of animal agriculture.  Not a difficult class if you study.

Very enthusiastic. He really knows what he's talking about. He sometimes gets off topic and jumps around when explaining things especially during lab when he's playing with chickens but that just makes the class more interesting. He is one of my favorite professors.
Very boring teacher.  He talked about a lot of stuff that didn't pertain to the material and was just kind of weird.

Prof. Cook is a really interesting guy. He knows what he's talking about and makes the class fun with personal tidbits. 101 also has a lot of other professors come in to lecture on topics, so you won't have him all the time. Just go to class and pay attention in lab and you'll be fine.
Dude loves his chickens.  great class.

He's a great lover of poultry but his enthusiasm and love for the subject makes the class enjoyable and entertaining. He enjoys elaborating which often are cut off by the bell. But the stories are fascinating and brings more clarification to the material. (loved the poultry lab! lots of fun!)
kind of boring in lecture but really knows what he is talking about

Come on, what's wrong with tangents?  you learn more in this class than in the rest of your ansci/dysci career.  Great class, you learn a lot and he tests you very fairly.  No reason to get below an AB in this class unless you don't try at all.  He's available to talk to outside of class as well.  great guy
He gets off on tangents and talks about things completely unrelated to the class.  It's a waste of time.

His lectures can be a little boring, but you can't find a nicer professor.  He is very understading seeing as he let me turn in my paper two days late. Quizes and labs are pretty easy and the exams are a breeze, (89% both times)
He is very boring and all he does is go off on rants about chickens and how rich he is.  Test are very hard and unless you like to learn about chickens don't have him as a prof!
He was the most interesting professor that i have ever had. I now love animal sciences! I would strongly reccomend that you take as many classes as you can by him!!!
